The following two hypothesis guide data collection : 1 . The primary hypothesis addition acourse M/MT standard care low back pain decrease pain 4 week compare standard care alone 2 . In addition , secondary hypothesis addition course M/MT standard care low back pain decrease pain increase function 2 4 week compare standard care alone
DOC.brief_title: Manual Manipulative Therapy Low Back Pain
DOC.detailed_description: Musculoskeletal injury among high frequency injury military personnel ( 1 ) . These may result training exercise , normal job duty , recreational activity ( 2 ) . Such injury may cause reduced level performance therefore decrease military readiness ( 1 ) . This prospective , randomize , clinical trial compare manual/manipulative therapy ( M/MT ) standard care standard care alone episodes low back pain . Patients randomized standard care standard care plus M/MT . Standard care consist medication prescribe credentialed medical provider ; M/MT deliver chiropractor physician . The trial time period 4 week outcome measurement intake , 2 week , 4 week . Outcome measure include Visual Analogue Scale ( VAS ) pain , Roland-Morris Low Back Pain Disability Questionnaire ( RDQ ) , Back Pain Functional Scale assess function ( 3 ) , Global Improvement Questionnaire patient perception regard improvement function , Patient Expectation Patient Satisfaction Questionnaires examine patient expectation toward care reception care , drug use profile . The SF-36 used measure general health component quality life sample ( 4 ) . This pragmatic study allow u opportunity develop investigation lead large scale robust clinical trial . In addition , study provide information challenge opportunity involve conduct clinical research concern M/MT military setting may lead additional study wider number base throughout US .
DOC.criteria: Active Duty Aged 1835 New episode low back pain ( LBP ) reoccurence past episode low back pain LBP somatic tissue determine history , examination , course ( i.e . pain refer visceral condition ) Radicular pain bad back pain Comorbid pathology poor health condition may directly impact spinal pain . Patients case histories physical examination finding indicate average health exclude study Bone joint pathology contraindicate patient M/MT . Patients spinal fracture , tumor , infection , inflammatory arthropathy significant osteoporosis refer appropriate care exclude study Other contraindication M/MT lumbar spine pelvis ( i.e . bleed disorder anticoagulant therapy ) Pregnancy ( potential female participant undergo pregnancy test ) Use manipulative care reason within past month Unable follow course care four week Unable give inform consent reason Unable confirm deploy course study : `` Will deploy , receive order distant temporary active duty assignment , attend training distant sight , otherwise absent Ft. Bliss next 6 week ? ''
